Name: 31_efficiency_energy_efficient_fuel
Representative_Docs: ['@johnredwood The most efficient combustion engines available on the market today have a fuel efficiency of 40 percent. That means they can convert only 40 percent of the fuel energy into movement. All the rest is lost in heat and friction. Your point?', "@DaveToke That's just how primary energy is defined. You can't calculate efficiency without knowing the thermal power rating. Solar and wind don't have stellar thermal efficiency either, but like nuclear it's not a big deal since you're not really burning fuel. https://t.co/VQe6Do53L3", "@DaveToke I guess since solar and wind aren't heat engines it would be turbine efficiency or solar efficiency or something. In any case, you can't calculate efficiency without knowing the primary energy! It's not a trick it's a necessary number to have."]
